news_header: The Michigan consumer confidence index fell to 67.8 in February, below expectations.
news_original_title: Yhdysvaltalaiskuluttajien inflaatio-odotukset kohosivat, Wall Street kääntyi laskuun
news_text: In February, the Michigan index of consumer confidence in the US dropped to 67.8, missing the Bloomberg forecast of 71.8. This decline follows January's index of 71.1. Consumer inflation expectations rose to 4.3%, up from 3.3% previously. The increase in inflation expectations is attributed to a trade war and new import duties by President Trump. Consequently, the stock market saw declines, with the Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all down.
